definition: Xiang Ying (1898-1941), communist general involved in forming the New Fourth Army 新四軍, killed in 1941 during the New Fourth Army incident 皖南事变

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
Lin Biao (1908-1971), Chinese army leader at time of the Cultural Revolution
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Li Xiannian (1909-1992), PRC general and politician
Bai Chongxi (1893-1966), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction, top Nationalist general, played important role in Chiang Kaishek's campaigns 1926-1949
Luo Ronghuan (1902-1963), Chinese communist military leader
